intro: Mimusops kilimandscharica, commonly known as the African snow apple, is a deciduous tree native to the dry regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and lance-shaped leaves. The tree produces fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by yellow, apple-like fruits. It is well adapted to arid environments and can tolerate drought conditions. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
